% Minimal LaTeX document for testing
% No external dependencies, no includes
\documentclass{article}

\title{Minimal Test Document}
\author{Test Suite}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle

\section{Introduction}

This is a minimal \LaTeX{} document used for testing the pure JavaScript
compilation pipeline. It contains no external dependencies and should compile
successfully in a single pass.

\subsection{Purpose}

The purpose of this fixture is to verify that:

\begin{itemize}
  \item The compilation pipeline can process valid \LaTeX{}
  \item PDF output is generated with correct magic bytes (\texttt{\%PDF-})
  \item The output is larger than 5KB (non-trivial content)
  \item No external packages are required
\end{itemize}

\section{Test Content}

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod
tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

\subsection{Mathematical Content}

The quadratic formula is:
\[
x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}
\]

\subsection{Lists}

Numbered list:
\begin{enumerate}
  \item First item
  \item Second item
  \item Third item
\end{enumerate}

\section{Conclusion}

This document should compile to a PDF of approximately 5-10KB in size,
suitable for automated testing.

\end{document}
